bioghist.p: Hermann Collitz (1855-1935) was an eminent German historical linguist and Indo-Europeanist, who spent much of his career in the United States. He received his doctorate in 1878 from the University of GÃ¶ttingen. In 1886, Collitz emigrated to the United States, where he taught at Bryn Mawr College. In 1907, he moved to Johns Hopkins University, where he took up a chair in Germanic studies. In 1924, Collitz was elected the first president of the Linguistic Society of America.

scopecontent.p: This collection contains correspondence, clippings, German exams, photographs, and personal memorabilia. The correspondence in English is largely related to administrative matters, along with requests for recommendations and invitations. There are a number of letters in German.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
